alert.note: Alert for Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 25 at 2:05AM MST until December 27 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible, with greatest potential in Elbert County. Total snow accumulations between 1 and 4 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Eastern portions of the Palmer Divide, including Ponderosa Park, Elizabeth, and Kiowa. * WHEN...From late tonight through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Roads may become slick and hazardous. Visibilities may drop below 1/4 mile due to falling and blowing snow. Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Persons should consider delaying travel.

area.areaDesc: Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet
